PERSONA:
juan morales, a 57-year-old mexican-american man, resides in the metropolitan area of chicago, illinois, within the east north central division of the midwest region. he was born in guadalajara, mexico, but has lived in the united states for 25 years, obtaining citizenship through naturalization 10 years ago. juan's educational background is a high school equivalency diploma, which he received after moving to the united states. he identifies as hispanic, specifically mexican, and his primary language is spanish, although he is fluent in english as well.

juan is a practicing roman catholic, attending mass at least once a week at the local st. pius v church in the pilsen neighborhood, where he has lived for the past 15 years with his wife, rosa. they have been married for 30 years and have two adult children who are both in college, one studying to be a nurse and the other an engineer. their daughter is a sophomore at the university of illinois at chicago, and their son is a junior at the illinois institute of technology.

juan works as a manager at a medium-sized manufacturing plant on the south side of chicago, overseeing a team of 10 people. his annual income is $72,500, and rosa works part-time as an administrative assistant at a dental clinic, earning $25,000 per year. they own a three-bedroom, two-bathroom townhouse in the brighton park neighborhood, which they purchased 10 years ago for $180,000. they have a 30-year mortgage with a monthly payment of $1,200.

juan is a registered democrat and considers himself a moderate. he is concerned about healthcare, education, and immigration policies. he believes that the current healthcare system is imperfect but prefers incremental improvements to the affordable care act rather than a complete overhaul. he values the importance of higher education and supports increased funding for public universities and community colleges. as an immigrant himself, juan is passionate about comprehensive immigration reform and a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.

in his free time, juan enjoys playing soccer with friends, watching mexican soccer leagues, and gardening in his small backyard. he is an avid user of the internet, frequently using social media platforms to stay updated on current events and connect with friends and family. despite his busy schedule, juan occasionally volunteers at the local parish, participating in community events and charity work.

juan's economic concerns are focused on maintaining a stable middle-class lifestyle, ensuring his children's education and career success, and saving for retirement. he is worried about the rising costs of healthcare, housing, and education, which he believes are threatening the stability of middle-class families like his own.
